name: The Rumpolitan
description: The Spaniard — a wonderfully cozy, cluttered, friendly pub in Belfast, Northern Ireland — has a fine assortment of rums and a winning way with rum-based cocktails. I’ve had many excellent daiquiris there, but I can also vouch for the Rumpolitan, the bar's alternative to a Cosmo. The Clément Créole Shrubb orange liqueur contributes a subtle, welcome note of bitterness and a flash of spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Shake the liquid ingredients with ice, and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the lime wedge.
